name: uncalled
content:
uncalled adjective
(FINANCE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
finance
  specialized in the form of shares or investments that a company has not completely paid for: The group said last month it had £1.25bn of uncalled capital commitments.
More examplesFewer examplesThe company had uncalled commitments to its investment funds of £14.5 billion.Meanwhile, the industry is sitting on £820bn of uncalled capital from investors.It also has £1.8bn of uncalled private equity commitments.
uncalled adjective
(NOT PUNISHED)
If an action that is against the rules or illegal is uncalled, it is not noticed or punished by officials: The would-be penalty went uncalled by the officials.
More examplesFewer examplesPlayers complained about obstruction that goes either undetected or uncalled. Several holding infractions had gone uncalled by officials at key moments. The referee allows several uncalled penalties, letting the game find its natural rhythm.

uncalled adjective
(NOT ASKED FOR)
not asked for or invited to do something: When all the names were crossed out, one child remained uncalled.
More examplesFewer examplesThe jury is not permitted to speculate as to what the testimony of the uncalled witness would be.

uncalled adjective
(NOT TELEPHONED)
not telephoned: We'd been phoning registered voters for weeks, but 2200 were uncalled when we ran out of time.
